revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Dell |model=Wyse Cloud Connect |revision=(CS1A13) |asin=B00IFEH5A6 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Inventec |price=129 |est_release_date=01/2014 |fcc_date=10/21/2013 |fcc_id=E2KCS1A13 |type=computer-on-a-stick, media streamer |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=multiple |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM28155 |cpu1_cspeed=1.0 GHz |cpu1_cores=2 |fla1=8 GiB |fla1_brand=SK hynix |fla1_model=H26M52003EQR |ram1=1 GiB |ram1_brand=SK hynix |ram1_model=H9TKNNN8KDMP |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 (Micro-B), USB 2.0 (Mini-B) |expansion_usb_num=2 |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM43013 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=abgn |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |eth_none=true |flags=Bluetooth 4.0 LE, Micro SD Card slot, MHL/HDMI combo connector |stock_os=Linux;Android;4.1; |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ip=acquired via DHCP }} {{TagLine|Ultra-compact Portable Cloud Access Device}} :[https://i.dell.com/sites/csdocuments/Shared-Content_data-Sheets_Documents/en/Dell-Wyse-Cloud-Connect-Discussion-guide-Final.pdf Datasheet]
"OPHELIA-6050A2585301" and "-USBPLUGRT-AX1-001" (and some additional stuff) :is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. This would appear to be the [http://www.dell.com/learn/us/en/555/campaigns/dell-wyse ''Dell Project Ophelia'' cloud access stick], previously touted at ''CES''.
This device can be powered solely with the MHL (also HDMI) connector.. :or via the (optional) Micro USB port <small>(also w/ OTG capability)</small>. DRAM chip appears to be mounted above the SoC.
===Links=== *[https://www.theregister.com/2014/04/09/review_dell_wyse_cloud_connect_android_ultrathin_client/ ''Dell Wyse Cloud Connect: Pocket Android desktop'' on '''The Register'''] :Antutu results indicate Broadcom Dual-core 1.0GHz chip :with a ''VideoCore IV'' GPU similar to [[Broadcom]] BCM28155 *[https://www.cnx-software.com/2014/01/30/dell-wyse-cloud-connect-android-mini-pc-is-now-available-for-129/ ''Dell Wyse Cloud Connect Android mini PC'' on '''CNX|Software'''] *[http://www.cnx-software.com/tag/dell/ ''Dell Wyse Cloud Connect'' on '''CNX|Software'''] :states the device was using RK3066 w/ 1GB RAM and 8GB Flash :at the time, which appears to have been imputed from [http://reviews.cnet.com/system-accessories/project-ophelia/4505-8896_7-35624727.html this '''C|Net''' post] :stating the use of a 1.6GHz Dual-core ARM (Cortex-A9) processor *[http://www.engadget.com/2013/10/21/dell-project-ophelia-fcc/ Blurb on '''Engadget''' about the device]
===Hardware specification=== *CPU: [[Broadcom]] BCM28155 @1.0GHz :Dual-Core ARM (Cortex-A9) *Storage: 8GB (eNAND) [[SK hynix]] Flash, :TF card (max.64GB)/MMC card slot *Memory: 1GB (LPDDR2) SDRAM *Wi-Fi: [[Broadcom]] BCM43013 :802.11abgn (1T1R) *Power Source: 5V via USB (Micro-B) Female :or MHL connectors
==Images== <gallery> File:Dell Wyse Cloud Connect Top.jpeg|Board Top File:Dell Wyse Cloud Connect Bottom.jpeg|Board Bottom </gallery>[[Has images::internal| ]]
